metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23172 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in SoX, where a heap-buffer-overflow occurs in function startread() in hcom.c file. The vulnerability is exploitable with a crafted hcomn file, that could cause an application to crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23172` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
libsox3 - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
sox - 14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '14.4.2+git20190427-2+deb11u1build0.20.04.1').
